definition: Command right and you will be obeyed cheerfully. (idiom)
pinyin: zhi3 hui1 you3 fang1 , ren2 ren2 le4 cong2

definition: lit. when a rat crosses the street, people chase it down (idiom)/fig. everyone detests a lowlife
pinyin: lao3 shu3 guo4 jie1 , ren2 ren2 han3 da3

definition: wine doesn't make men drunk: men get themselves intoxicated. Lust does not overpower men: men surrender themselves to lust
pinyin: jiu3 bu4 zui4 ren2 ren2 zi4 zui4 , se4 bu4 mi2 ren2 ren2 zi4 mi2
containing_words.word: 酒不醉人人自醉，色不迷人人自迷

definition: wine doesn't make men drunk: men get themselves intoxicated. Lust does not overpower men: men surrender themselves to lust
pinyin: jiu3 bu4 zui4 ren2 ren2 zi4 zui4 , se4 bu4 mi2 ren2 ren2 zi4 mi2
containing_words.word: 酒不醉人人自醉，色不迷人人自迷

sentences.english: Therefore many officials were killed in his ruling period.
sentences.chinese: 他统治时期法律严酷，造成了人人自危的恐怖统治。

sentences.english: More weeks of life-saving Church, I wish everyone good health.
sentences.chinese: 愈周救生堂，祝愿人人身体健康。

sentences.english: Mung bean soup is a well known summer better Jieshu drinks.
sentences.chinese: 绿豆汤是人人皆知的夏季较好的解暑饮料。

sentences.english: Ms. priority is a well-known code of conduct.
sentences.chinese: 女士优先是一个人人皆知的行为准则。

sentences.english: On wheels or on foot, everyone was rushing.
sentences.chinese: 不管坐车还是步行，人人都来去匆匆。

sentences.english: If you leave the competition now,people will think you're flinging up the sponge.
sentences.chinese: 如果你现在退出比赛，人人都会认为你输了。

sentences.english: Not all the members of my family are TV lovers.
sentences.chinese: 我们家并非人人都爱看电视。

sentences.english: Originally in foreign countries, as long as you are working, car and houses are for everyone.
sentences.chinese: 原来在国外，只要你是劳动者，汽车洋房人人有份。

sentences.english: Of course, not everyone is negative.
sentences.chinese: 当然，并非人人都持负面看法。

sentences.english: "But everyone can see that you enjoyed the smell of my fried fish with your rice, " argued the woman.
sentences.chinese: 可人人都能看见你就着我的煎鱼的气味吃了米饭。

sentences.english: Each human being has a place of poverty.
sentences.chinese: 人人都有一处贫穷之地。

sentences.english: Everyone ought to rarefy his spiritual life.
sentences.chinese: 人人都应当纯洁其精神生活。

sentences.english: She found everyone there had a pair of fragrant feet.
sentences.chinese: 她发现，人人都有双香脚。

sentences.english: Nick:No wonder almost everyone in our office has a Masters Degree.
sentences.chinese: 难怪我们办公室几乎人人都念过硕士。

sentences.english: So everyone can roll in fornication?
It is known to everyone that stream rises from very hot water.
sentences.chinese: 人人都知道蒸气是从很热的水里冒出来的。

definition: ordinary person/private citizen/people/the person in the street
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
always/at all times/never (if used in negative sentence)
to have become common practice (idiom)/to become a general trend
someone/people/anyone/there is someone there/occupied (as in restroom)
there are plenty of such people
